measured_by: intertemporal choice task (smaller-sooner vs. larger-later rewards)
justification: The article states that "participants choose between a smaller but sooner food or monetary reward and a larger but later alternative... Preferences in intertemporal choices are gauged by delay discounting," indicating that this choice task operationalizes delay discounting.

topic_or_construct: Preference for allocating resources across time intervals
justification: When describing inclusion criteria, the authors note that "the dependent variable was delay discounting or an index indicated the preference of allocating resources across intervals (e.g., saving vs. spending)," showing that the saving–spending index is used to measure resource-allocation preference across time.
